definition: sparrow/(dialect) mahjong
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
surname Ma
a freckle/lentigo
small bird/sparrow/also pr. [qiao3]
lit. to dissect a sparrow; fig. a preliminary test on a small sample
(bird species of China) house sparrow (Passer domesticus)
(bird species of China) russet sparrow (Passer rutilans)
the Great Sparrow Campaign or the Four Pests Campaign, one of the actions during the Great Leap Forward 大躍進|大跃进[Da4 yue4 jin4] aiming to eliminate four pests: rats, flies, mosquitoes, and sparrows
(bird species of China) Eurasian tree sparrow (Passer montanus)
lit. to catch sparrows blindfolded (idiom)/fig. to act blindly
pinyin: bi4 se4 yan3 jing1 zhuo1 ma2 que4

definition: The sparrow may be small but all its vital organs are there (idiom)./small but complete in every detail
pinyin: ma2 que4 sui1 xiao3 , wu3 zang4 ju4 quan2

definition: (bird species of China) Spanish sparrow (Passer hispaniolensis)
(bird species of China) saxaul sparrow (Passer ammodendri)

sentences.english: There were laughter and song in the air.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀在吱吱喳喳地叫着，空氣中飄蕩着歡歌笑語。

sentences.english: Fry shelled fresh shrimps additionally to also have similar effect with spadger egg according to the report.
sentences.chinese: 另據報道用麻雀蛋炒蝦仁也有類似功效。

sentences.english: Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
sentences.chinese: 不要懼怕，你們比許多麻雀還貴重。

sentences.english: The sparrow may be small, fully-equipped.
The sparrows chirp outside the window every morning.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀每天清晨在窗外嘁嘁喳喳地叫。

sentences.english: Mahjong tiles with buck, indicator, three dices and box (Used)
sentences.chinese: 舊麻雀牌連莊，起莊，三粒骰及盒。

sentences.english: The housetops, the trees, and the sparrows proclaimed the spring.
sentences.chinese: 屋頂，樹木以及麻雀都在宣佈春天的到來。

sentences.english: I want to wait a good long after the little sparrow wings, they fly it.
sentences.chinese: 我想等小麻雀翅膀長好後，就放飛它。

sentences.english: Right now, only some English sparrows and a curved-bill thrasher.
sentences.chinese: 現在只有一些英國麻雀和弧形喙的長尾鮫。

sentences.english: Little sparrows fluttered among the branches.
sentences.chinese: 小麻雀在枝條間飛來飛去。

sentences.english: A branch which was limed to catch sparrows.
sentences.chinese: 樹枝被塗上黏鳥膠以捕捉麻雀。

sentences.english: It is illegal to paint sparrows to sell them as parakeets .
sentences.chinese: 將麻雀彩繪成鸚哥出售是違法的。

sentences.english: Xiao Qing held the wounded sparrow in both hands.
sentences.chinese: 小晴雙手捧着那隻受傷的小麻雀。

sentences.english: Like a fluttering sparrow or a darting swallow, an undeserved curse does not come to rest.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀往來，燕子翻飛，這樣，無故的咒詛也必不臨到。

sentences.english: Sparrow, won’t you fly down south by me?
sentences.chinese: 麻雀啊，你願意隨我飛到南方嗎？

sentences.english: The sparrow is sorry for the peacock at the burdern of its tail.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀因孔雀馱着翎尾而替它擔憂。

bird

bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

wild duck/mallard (Anas platyrhyncha)
(of a bird) to peck at food
bird
swallow
pheasant/unregistered and operating illegally (business)/(slang) prostitute
crow/raven
